title: US H-1B Visa Quota Full For 2025. What Applicants Should Do Now
content: A congressional cap of 65,000 H-1B visas for regular applicants and an additional 20,000 visas for US advanced degree holders have been mandated by the US government.
summary: A congressional cap of 65,000 H-1B visas for regular applicants and an additional 20,000 visas for US advanced degree holders have been mandated by the US government.

title: ISRO Puts PROBA-3 In Orbit. A 10-Point Guide About The European Satellite
content: Indian space agency ISRO today successfully launched the European Space Agency's PROBA-3 satellite. The launch was on board ISRO's workhorse rocket - the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle or PSLV in its 61st commercial mission 'C-59'.
summary: Indian space agency ISRO today successfully launched the European Space Agency's PROBA-3 satellite. The launch was on board ISRO's workhorse rocket - the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle or PSLV in its 61st commercial mission 'C-59'.

title: Scientists Reveal Real Face Of Santa Claus After 1,700 Years. See Pics
content: Scientists have revealed the face of Saint Nicholas of Myra, the real-life bishop who inspired the concept of modern-day Santa Claus.
summary: Scientists have revealed the face of Saint Nicholas of Myra, the real-life bishop who inspired the concept of modern-day Santa Claus.

title: "Reflected On Lessons Learnt": India On Diplomatic Talks With China
content: To prevent recurrence of military standoff along their contested border, India and China on Thursday reflected on the lessons learnt from the eastern Ladakh face-off that ended a few weeks ago following completion of the disengagement process.
summary: To prevent recurrence of military standoff along their contested border, India and China on Thursday reflected on the lessons learnt from the eastern Ladakh face-off that ended a few weeks ago following completion of the disengagement process.

title: FBI Warns Texts Between Android, iPhone Could Be Hacked, Shares Safety Tips
content: FBI urged citizens to use encryption to secure their communications amid a massive Chinese cyberattack.
summary: FBI urged citizens to use encryption to secure their communications amid a massive Chinese cyberattack.

title: Mysterious Flu-Like Disease Kills At Least 79 People In Africa
content: An unknown disease with flu-like symptoms has killed at least 79 people in the Democratic Republic of Congo, according to the BBC.
summary: An unknown disease with flu-like symptoms has killed at least 79 people in the Democratic Republic of Congo, according to the BBC.

title: World Health Organization Gives First Approval Of Tuberculosis Test
content: The World Health Organization announced Thursday it had given a first-ever green light to a test for tuberculosis -- a disease which killed 1.25 million people last year.
summary: The World Health Organization announced Thursday it had given a first-ever green light to a test for tuberculosis -- a disease which killed 1.25 million people last year.

title: Is Tim Cook Ready To Retire? Apple CEO Says "I Will Do It Until The ..."
content: Mr Cook, who took over as CEO in August 2011, said he'll continue to lead the company until he feels it's time to move on.
summary: Mr Cook, who took over as CEO in August 2011, said he'll continue to lead the company until he feels it's time to move on.

title: "Breaking Glass Ceiling": Namibia's First Woman President
content: Namibia's first woman president Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah on Thursday said her victory in a disputed vote last week had broken a "glass ceiling".
summary: Namibia's first woman president Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah on Thursday said her victory in a disputed vote last week had broken a "glass ceiling".

title: Impeached, Jailed Or Assassinated: South Korea's Dark History Of Leadership
content: After making an effort to suspend civilian rule in South Korea and impose martial law, President Yoon Suk Yeol stands facing impeachment. But that's not the only downfall the country has witnessed.
summary: After making an effort to suspend civilian rule in South Korea and impose martial law, President Yoon Suk Yeol stands facing impeachment. But that's not the only downfall the country has witnessed.

title: 14 Indian Fishermen Arrested Over Alleged Poaching, Says Sri Lankan Navy
content: The Sri Lankan Navy has said it has arrested 14 more Indian fishermen for allegedly fishing in the island nation's territorial waters and seized two fishing trawlers.
summary: The Sri Lankan Navy has said it has arrested 14 more Indian fishermen for allegedly fishing in the island nation's territorial waters and seized two fishing trawlers.

title: How Interstellar Objects And Rogue Planets Can Be Trapped In Solar System
content: The key to this phenomenon lies in the concept of phase space, a mathematical representation that describes the state of a dynamical system like our solar system.
summary: The key to this phenomenon lies in the concept of phase space, a mathematical representation that describes the state of a dynamical system like our solar system.

title: France's Macron Seeks New PM After No-Confidence Defeat
content: The vote was the first successful no-confidence action since a defeat for Georges Pompidou's government in 1962, when Charles de Gaulle was president.
summary: The vote was the first successful no-confidence action since a defeat for Georges Pompidou's government in 1962, when Charles de Gaulle was president.

title: Japan's "Divine Gift" Sake Recognised As UNESCO's Cultural Heritage
content: Producers hope this will boost interest in the traditional drink worldwide amid its waning popularity back home, with youngsters preferring imported wine, domestic beer or whiskey.
summary: Producers hope this will boost interest in the traditional drink worldwide amid its waning popularity back home, with youngsters preferring imported wine, domestic beer or whiskey.

title: Putin Praises PM Modi's Policies, Says Russia Will Now 'Make In India'
content: Russia will set up manufacturing plants across India, Vladimir Putin said today as he praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his "India-first" policies.
summary: Russia will set up manufacturing plants across India, Vladimir Putin said today as he praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his "India-first" policies.

title: Rapper Cardi B Claims She Spends About $3 Million A Month
content: Grammy-winning rapper Cardi B has put an end to rumours about her financial stability and revealed that she spends around $3 million a month.
summary: Grammy-winning rapper Cardi B has put an end to rumours about her financial stability and revealed that she spends around $3 million a month.

title: Bangladesh Court Bans Broadcasts Of Sheikh Hasina's "Hate Speech"
content: A Bangladeshi tribunal banned broadcasts of "hate speech" by autocratic ex-premier Sheikh Hasina on Thursday, weeks after indicting her over the killing of protesters during the August revolution that ousted her.
summary: A Bangladeshi tribunal banned broadcasts of "hate speech" by autocratic ex-premier Sheikh Hasina on Thursday, weeks after indicting her over the killing of protesters during the August revolution that ousted her.

title: Bitcoin Blasts $100K Barrier Amid Trump's Vow To Make US "Crypto Capital"
content: With president-elect Donald Trump promising to make the US "the crypto capital of the planet", Bitcoin price is up more than 130 per cent so far this year.
summary: With president-elect Donald Trump promising to make the US "the crypto capital of the planet", Bitcoin price is up more than 130 per cent so far this year.

title: Best And Worst Airlines Of 2024, According To AirHelp Score Report

title: This Type Of Chocolate Could Reduce Type 2 Diabetes Risk By 21%
content: A study from Harvard TH Chan School of Public Health reveals that consuming dark chocolate could reduce the risk of type 2 diabetes by 21%, unlike milk chocolate, which is linked to long-term weight gain.
summary: A study from Harvard TH Chan School of Public Health reveals that consuming dark chocolate could reduce the risk of type 2 diabetes by 21%, unlike milk chocolate, which is linked to long-term weight gain.
